utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing to my desk?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, well, Gates is on vacation, so I figured why not do my paperwork from home with my husband? That is, if you want to play hooky with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it technically playing hooky if we’re working?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we could work for a bit and them maybe … take a nap.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. I like naps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, naps are good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang on. Oh, it’s a call forwarded from the PI office. Richard Castle Investigations. Speaking. Yes. No, great. I’ll see you in twenty minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, ‘bye. Well, for once in the relationship I’m the one getting the call. I have a potential client.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s fantastic!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s not. I was going to spend the day with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s fine. It’s not like I don’t leave at a moment’s notice when there’s a homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, maybe if I’m done soon, I can swing by later for, you know, a nap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you do you’ll be napping alone, because if you’re going to your office then I’m going to mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knock ‘em dead, babe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Well, hello there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must be Mrs. Whitfield. I’m Richard Castle. Oh, ouch. What happened there?

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Just cut myself. Richard. Really? Come on. Richard Rodgers. You really don’t remember me? Faircroft Prep. AP Chem. I used to cheat off of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eva.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Eva, yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eva Hendricks!

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Well, I’m Eva Whitfield, now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I’m Richard Castle, now.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: I know. I’ve read your books. Followed your adventures with the NYPD. I heard you were a PI. So, well, I – uh –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, why don’t we go inside and talk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Eva, tell me. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Um … it’s my husband. Cole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: He’s a stockbroker. He’s bright. He handsome. Charming. We got married and it was so wonderful. Um … but then, in the last few years it’s gotten – – so difficult.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Rick, I think he’s cheating on me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what makes you think that?

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: The way he acts. Um, the hours he keeps. I mean, I should have seen it coming. He insisted on a prenup. I just – I have to find out the truth. Can you help me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m – I’m sorry, Eva. This is really not the kind of work I like to take on.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Please, Rick. I – I just – I just want to know if there’s anything left in my marriage to fight for. Please?

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, I’ll just need Cole’s information and a recent photo.

utterance.speaker: EVA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. What I’m talking about here is knowing what you have and getting what’s right.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Okay, okay, okay. But you do realize, this could be a serious payday?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Please, it’s chump change.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Don’t be glib, Cole. It’s a legitimate point.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Scottie.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Do you trust me?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Of course I trust you.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Robert.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Then we’re not selling the company. At least, not at this time and not at that price. Agreed.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Agreed.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Agreed.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Cole, you need a ride back to the office?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No. I have a doctor’s appointment.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Okay. I will see you there. Robert.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Hey. So I’ve got this pain and uh, I could either go see a doctor … or I could come see you.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yeah? I like the sound of that. Oh, I’m coming. I’ll see you soon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So her husband was having an affair and you caught him cheating?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Caught him red-handed and bare-bottomed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, poor Eva. How’s she taking it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not well. I spent the last half-hour on the phone with her. Lots of crying. She’s packing up now to leave him. She wants me to drop these pictures by, first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She wants to see firsthand that her marriage is over. What am I going to tell her? No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just don’t let her cry on your shoulder too long.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, remind me never to take this kind of case again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, you’re the one who said you’re going to have to pay your dues as a PI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that was before I knew what it meant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would it help at all if I cooked you dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Immeasurably.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what time can you make it home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … Westchester and back, factoring in time for shoulder crying ­– – eight thirty, nine?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll see you then. I love you.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: You’re not even trying.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Would you just – – hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s going on with Castle’s case?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t try to change the subject.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not talking about this anymore, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you not talking about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan is all up on my back because I’m not dating anyone right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell her why.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A while ago we buy this couples weekend ski trip. It’s next month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, except Lanie and Espo have broken up yet again, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? You guys have. Come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s no reason for him and Jenny to think I can’t find anyone else to take. I mean, come on. I have no problem getting girls.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s the thing. You don’t have to get one. Jenny and I already – – we have a friend –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, are you talking about a blind date? Oh, hell no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo! Just hear him out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her name is Stacy. She’s fantastic. She runs a music store. She’s into sports. And we told her all about you. She wants to meet. Take a look at her picture.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s all right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s all right? Espo, she’s stunning. And you won’t even meet with her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, maybe I will. But only because she’s so excited to meet me. And, you know, I don’t like to disappoint the ladies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice. Good job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, are you on your way home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, he killed her. He killed her – he -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, can you hear me? Damn it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He took my car. Damn it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, she’s dead. She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, slow down. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eva was murdered by her husband. He killed her and I couldn’t – I couldn’t stop it. I couldn’t –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Neely, as I already told you, I followed Cole Whitfield out here. He must have knocked me out because when I came to he was gone and so was my car.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE NEELY
utterance.content: And why did you go to his house in the first place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To give the photos to Eva. That’s when I heard the screaming and I saw him dragging her body through the kitchen. Before I could do anything he drove off with her.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, it says here you only got your PI license a month ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. So?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: So are you sure about what you saw?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course I’m sure!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective, I know Castle. If he says it happened, it did.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER KEMP
utterance.content: Part of his story checks out. We found his car parked on an access road about a hundred yards from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whitfield must have hidden Castle’s car to make his getaway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective, I’m not making this up. The Whitfield house is a crime scene. If we go to that kitchen we will find blood. Eva’s blood.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: I’m Detective Neely. Do you have a few minutes to talk?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: So, what is this all about? What can I do for you folks?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Mr. Whitfield, is your wife, Eva, home?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Do you know where she is?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No, I don’t. I got home about twenty minutes ago, found this lovely note from Eva.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: She figured out I’m having an affair and she left me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She left him. I can’t believe this guy. He forged that note.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: I can’t even get in touch with her. I tried calling her, I tried calling her. The phone just goes straight to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you drive a black Model S?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No, that’s – that’s Eva’s car. Has something happened to Eva?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: We’re not quite sure. But you’re saying you only got home twenty minutes ago?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Right. Around 9:30.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where were you at 7:45 tonight?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: I was, um … I was still in the city. I was still at work. You know what? I – I think I need a refill. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s lying. He’s lying about everything.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: If you’re right there should be blood evidence in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was here. It happened right here. He must have cleaned it up. Why else would he invite us so freely into his house?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: If he did, he did a hell of a good job of it. UV shows no sign of residue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, I know what I saw. There. There! See, I knew it!

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Knew what? What is going on?

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Sir, there’s blood residue here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Whitfield, do you know where this came from?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yes. My wife is a klutz. She broke a jar, cut her hand cleaning it up. Bled everywhere until she finally bandaged it. Why – why are you looking for blood residue?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Are you suggesting I did something to my wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, we’re not suggesting, Mr. Whitfield.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Get out. Get out of my house. Get out. Now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How long have you been up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He probably came home, saw that Eva was about to leave him, and killed her in a fit of rage. I told her everything was going to be all right. I promised her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, babe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you heard from Detective Neely?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She said that search teams didn’t find anything in the woods.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s because Cole knew he couldn’t leave her out there, not once I was on to him. So he put her back in the car, dumped it and the body someplace else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Westchester’s got a BOLO out on Eva’s car and they’ve flagged her credit cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have they pinged her cell phone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They tried. But it’s either off or dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m going to go with dead. What about his alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he wasn’t at work, like he said. His business partner said that he left at 6PM, not at 8.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Plenty of time to get back to Westchester by 7:45.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But when Detective Neely confronted him about it he revised his story. He said he was with his mistress, Taylor McKinley, that woman you took pictures of, until 8PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I don’t have any jurisdiction. This isn’t my case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but it’s my case. Eva hired me. She was my friend. And he killed her right in front of me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll talk to the mistress. But just me. Not you. You’re too close to this, okay?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR MCKINLEY
utterance.content: So? We had an affair and his wife left. What’s the big deal? That stuff happens every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except wives don’t go missing every day.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: It’s a little soon to say she’s missing, isn’t it? I’m sure she’ll be back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. McKinley, how long have you known Mr. Whitfield?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Since he started my yoga class a year ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when did the affair begin?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: About a week later. What? He’s hot. And rich.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time did he come to your apartment last night?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Like I told the other Detective, he showed up right around 6 and he left just after 8.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the two of you were in the apartment the whole time?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well? What’d you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s confrontational. And a little too ready with her answers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think she’s lying?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go down to her building. See if anyone else saw Cole Whitfield there last night. And let’s look into Mr. Whitfield, see what else he’s hiding from us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s in the bags, Cole? And where are you taking them?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I was –

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: You accuse me of murder then you come stalking around my home? What the hell is your damage, man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – my damage?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not the one who killed my wife.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: You’re insane, you know that? Eva’s alive. She just called me twenty minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a liar.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I wish. Because she told me to go screw myself and that she cleaned out our joint bank accounts. Yeah, you don’t believe me? You can check with my bank. While you guys were searching my house the b*tch stole $7.4 million dollars from me.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Mr. Whitfield? Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Yes. This man is harassing me. Hey. You’ll never prove a thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you crazy? What were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You saw him last night. He’s cocky. What do all cocky men do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Make mistakes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Wait, you’re talking about me now, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re the only witness and you are ruining your credibility when I’m trying to help you. What if this gets back to Gates?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just trying to find some proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right now the proof lies with Cole. Eva’s phone records confirm a call to him at 9:35 this morning. And there’s also that $7.4 million dollar transfer to a Swiss bank account last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes! He’s creating reasonable doubt. Building the narrative that she stole from him, that she’s on the run. That’s why we can’t find the body. That’s his plan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Just got back from the mistress' apartment building. No one remembers seeing Whitfield at all last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Proving he wasn’t there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Proving that no one saw him. Without a body we’re going to need something more solid than that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, guess what? Turns out Whitfield was married before. In Los Angeles, Mallory Whitfield. She had an inheritance worth several million dollars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Had?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. She died in a hiking accident in Angeles National Forest. Fell into a ravine. Guess who the only witness was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her husband, Cole.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bingo. The cops tried to make a murder case against him, but he had all the answers. They could never make any of the charges stick. Her entire estate went to Cole, which he used to start his business and build his fortune.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he got away with it before and now he’s trying to do it again. This is no crime of passion. He planned the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Cole’s first wife dies suspiciously, and then the second one disappears.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No way that’s a coincidence. This guy’s a Black Widow. Or rather, Black Widower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only this time there’s no body. He’s trying to create the illusion that Eva’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and he’s going to some major trouble to make that illusion seem real. Castle, you said that Cole Whitfield was at home in Westchester this morning, right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right; he never left.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just got the data back from Eva’s phone. The call to Cole pinged off a tower in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He must have had someone use Eva’s phone to make that call. He’s got an accomplice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And whoever it is made that call somewhere near 31st and 4th.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s where I took those photos. His mistress, Taylor, lives on that block.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Taylor lied about his alibi, she might have made that phone call. Why don’t you guys go and pick her up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, damn, that means I’m going to have to cancel that lunch date with Stacy, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. You can’t. You have to make a good first impression.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, for heaven’s sake. You know what? Go, enjoy your date. Ryan and I’ll go and get her.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: I already answered all your questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And now we have more, because new information has come to light.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: What new information?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Before we get to that, I’d like to revisit something that you said at our last meeting. You said that Cole was at your apartment between 6 and 8 last night. Are you still saying that now?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: None of your neighbors saw him.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Well, he’s very discreet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you to say he was at your apartment?

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he ask you to call him from someone else’s cellphone?

utterance.speaker: AUBREY HASKINS
utterance.content: Taylor, don’t say another word. Aubrey Haskins, attorney for Miss McKinley.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Wait, who are you?

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: It’s okay. Cole sent me. I’m general counsel for his company. Just let me do the talking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Taylor, listen to me. If you provided a false alibi, that makes you an accomplice. That means jail.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Accomplice to what, exactly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The murder of Eva Whitfield.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Eva’s not dead. Cole spoke with her this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he spoke to someone using her cell phone. That call pinged off of a tower right next to your apartment building at 9:35AM.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Detective, unless you have proof –

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Wait, are you accusing me of making that call? I was at work at 9:35, at the yoga studio.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Taylor, I’ve got your schedule. You don’t work in the mornings.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: No, but I got called in to cover for another instructor who was sick. I was there from 9:30AM to 11. You can check that.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: We’re done here, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was a crafty move. Cole sent his in-house lawyer to silence his girlfriend. He’s keeping this thing contained. In the family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but now that Taylor’s lawyered up how are we going to break her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By digging into her story. I’ll call her work, check into her alibi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, partner. How’d the date go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can we talk about it out here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’d you think of Stacy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, man, she was great.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Until I started getting the stalker vibe from her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. We were right in the middle of appetizers, and that’s when she told me that the blue shorts I was wearing during the triathlon made my legs look sexy. Which is true, but – – how did she even know I competed? Never mind what color shorts I was wearing. And that’s when she told me that she saw a photo on my profile.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, this is funny to you? You signed me up for Match.com? Behind my back?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, technically Jenny did. I – I’ve only been … managing your profile.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you think I wouldn’t find out? I almost arrested that girl.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we were hoping that you’d be so into her that you’d just let it go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you? I can find my own dates.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know. But you haven’t. And the ski weekend is coming up. Look, look, look, look. We were just trying to help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t need your help. This isn’t over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manager at the yoga studio verified that Taylor was at work from 9:30 to 11AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then the manager’s lying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, she had a classroom full of thirty people. She didn’t make that call. But whoever did made sure to do it right by Taylor’s building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means someone wants us to believe it was Taylor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we would’ve, if she didn’t get called into work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Called into work? Of course. Taylor getting called into work is the one thing the person behind this couldn’t have foreseen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That person being Cole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Beckett, the murder was staged. This whole thing, it’s a work of fiction. It’s a – it’s a Hitchcock movie with me cast as the witness. I’m Jimmy Stewart in Vertigo. The reason we haven’t found a body is because there is no body. Eva’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eva’s alive? Castle, that’s not what you believed a moment ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It didn’t hit me until just now. Eva is the one person who would want Cole to look like a murderer and his mistress an accomplice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You saw Cole kill Eva. I mean, you did, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw what she wanted me to see. That’s why she wanted me to drop off the photos that night. Eva’s been behind this from the start and I’m the gullible PI that fell for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she go to that length?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Eva wanted more than just out of the marriage. She wanted Cole to suffer. She set him up. He swore that she called him because she did call him. She also transferred the $7.4 million to the Swiss bank account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s her walking away money. I am telling you, Beckett. I am right about this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. When? Okay, thanks. Castle, I’m sorry, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Beckett, I know it’s crazy. But Eva is still alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, she’s not. They found her body in the Hudson. Eva’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no way Eva is really dead. In a classic Hitchcock-ian twist, it won’t be her body. Mark my words.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then who did we pull out of the river?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone who could pass for Eva.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’ll run her prints. That should clear up whether it’s Eva or not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except her prints will be altered. Her face, unrecognizable. All part of Eva’s plan to commit the perfect crime. You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. She looks just like Eva.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s because it is Eva. Her prints match. This is your girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it can’t be.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I checked her dental records, too, Castle. It’s her. I wish I could tell you it wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I take it the cause of death is blunt force trauma?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It looks like a massive skull fracture in the parietal region. But she just came in, so I’ve only done a preliminary exam. Once I finish my autopsy I’ll give you a call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m sorry about your friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now that we have a body maybe that will give us some leverage.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Taylor. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: My lawyer said not to speak with you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fine. Then just listen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know what Cole told you, but his wife is dead. Her body was found less than two hours ago.

utterance.speaker: TAYLOR
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Listen, Taylor. If you want to stay out of prison, now’s the time to tell us the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Haskins, welcome back. You seem to be representing everyone in this matter.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Before we begin, Mr. Whitfield is here only because you said you have information on his wife’s whereabouts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cole, you said that you spoke with Eva this morning. What did she say?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: She said it was over and that she was leaving town.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Detective, did you find Mrs. Whitfield or not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, we found her. In the Hudson. Murdered. By you.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: That’s a lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Taylor gave you up. She said that you weren’t with her last night.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: You spoke to my client without me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She waived her right. Mr. Whitfield, if you weren’t with Taylor last night, then where were you?

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Don’t answer that. Are you pressing charges?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Inevitably, yeah.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Cole, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you did it.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Do not speak to my client.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You killed her. I saw you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Castle, hey.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Detective, what the hell kind of precinct is this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just take your client and go home. We’ll be coming back for you soon enough.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, I know. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re stressed. Go home and try to relax.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know you will, but right now you just need to walk away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, you’re right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: During the autopsy I discovered that Eva’s fingernail on her left index had been split down the middle. Wedged in that crack were these three hairs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These hairs must have gotten transferred during the struggle.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Most likely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, how fast can you test these? Cole’s DNA is still on file from when he was suspected of murdering his first wife.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I already ran them and they’re a match. Cole Whitfield is your man.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER KEMP
utterance.content: Mr. Whitfield! Mr. Whitfield, we have a warrant for your arrest.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: No answer, not at the front or the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His SUV’s in the driveway.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER KEMP
utterance.content: Should we take the door?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no need.

utterance.speaker: NEELY
utterance.content: Mr. Whitfield? Show yourself. Let’s not make it harder than it has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you doing okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just never thought the story would end like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet Cole didn’t, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but suicide? What did the ME say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That it looks like he wrapped the cord around his neck and stepped off the balcony. Look, I’m sorry. I know that this isn’t how you wanted it to end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. Beckett, are you still awake?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Something’s bothering me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? Something’s bothering me, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would a guy like Cole commit suicide?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because a guy like Cole didn’t think he could face going to prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As wealthy and connected as he was, would he have even gone to prison? The case against him was circumstantial. He could have beaten it in court.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, evidently he didn’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s too clean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop chasing the mice in your head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if they’ll lead me to the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’ll deal with it in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Hey. I brought you some coffee on my way to – wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You definitely don’t need any more coffee. Hey. What is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, a timeline. Eva is red, Cole is green, and Taylor is blue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A timeline for a case that’s closed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet. Cole didn’t kill himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Based on what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Based on his personality. Cole is cocky. He’s entitled. He’s far too much of a narcissist to commit suicide, so if he didn’t kill himself that means he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s a pretty big ‘if’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It changes everything. Because if Cole didn’t kill himself, it follows that he didn’t murder Eva. Someone else did. That’s why it was staged to look like a suicide; so the police would conclude that he was the guilty party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then whoever killed Cole also killed Eva. And who would that be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man I saw attacking her. Whoever hit me in the woods.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who you said was Cole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wanted me to believe he was Cole. It was just all theater.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle, let’s say for a second that someone snuck into the house disguised as Cole and attacked Eva. How could they possibly know that you were going to be there to witness it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he had to have been in on it with Eva.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Eva is a part of this setup then why is she in the morgue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because, in classic Hitchcock fashion, her co-conspirator doubled crossed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “The Articles of Incorporation for Whitfield and Galloway”. Cole’s company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It took me two boxes of cronuts to get that out of the county clerk’s office. See, Cole and his partner, Scott Galloway, were in business together. But in that document it says if anything happens to one of them, the other one gains control of the company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re suggesting that Scott Galloway was Eva’s co-conspirator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I listened to the recording I made of their lunch.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: This could be a serious payday.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Please. It’s chump change, Scott.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Don’t be glib, Cole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They were getting a major offer to buy out their firm, an offer that Cole was against. So I did a credit check on Scott Galloway. He was in massive debt. A buyout would have fixed all that. But in order for that to happen, he needed control of the company. Eva wanted out of her marriage and she wanted Cole punished. So they teamed up to take Cole out of the picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there’s no evidence that supports this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was Scott Galloway. It has to be. Beckett, will you please just check Scott’s alibi? Would you do that for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will. But listen to me. Eva was your friend. She came here, to this very office, and asked for your help, and now she’s dead and you feel responsible, and that can make you see ghosts.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, we’re looking into Scott Galloway now? Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought everything pointed to Cole Whitfield being out killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It does.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you believe this theory of Castle’s?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I believe that he’s been right too many times not to consider it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I was just about to call you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, I’ve been thinking about it. And with the benefit of hindsight, you’re right. I can see how I might have tumbled down the rabbit hole. Scott Galloway probably has nothing to do with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he doesn’t. His alibi checks out. But you were right, Castle. We found proof that Cole didn’t kill Eva. And I know who did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scott Galloway is in the clear. At 7:45, when Eva was supposedly attacked, he was at his son’s basketball game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said you had proof that Cole didn’t kill Eva. What is it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your theory about Scott didn't pan out, but we did due diligence, looked at other people in Cole’s life. That’s when we found this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that Cole’s SUV?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is. Street cams show that Cole was in this house, which is in Scarsdale, from 6 to 8PM.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Therefore Cole could not have been the man that you saw attack Eva.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And here’s another fun fact: Cole visited that house on a regular basis between 6 and 8PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose house is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Robert James. One of the other executives at Whitfield and Galloway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was at the lunch. But what was Cole doing at Robert James’ house?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he wasn’t there to see Robert James. Turns out, he always works late at the office. But Mrs. James was there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Cole was having a second affair with his colleague’s wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is probably why he lied about where he was that night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The wife confirmed the affair, but she thought that nobody knew about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can we put Robert James near the Whitfield house that night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn right we can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. James, thank you so much for coming in.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Of course. Though I’m not quite sure how I can help you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you can start by telling me where you were two nights ago at 8PM.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Well, I work late. I was at the office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. You weren’t. In fact, this is you at a tollbooth at 7:04PM, heading to Cole’s house in Westchester. There is no need for lying here. When Eva found out that Cole was sleeping with your wife she came to you with a plan.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He had betrayed the both of you. You wanted revenge.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: The man looked me in the eye every day and then he went to my home, to my wife? He deserved what he got.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you staged the attack on Eva in her house.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Yes. So that PI would see it and the trail would lead straight to Cole. It was all for show, of course. Cole gets arrested, Eva gets his money and disappears.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did Eva end up dead?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: I – I don’t know. I spoke to her the next morning. Eva was stressed out. Regretful. Said the plan was never her idea in the first place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose plan was it?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: I don’t know. But – but she was having second thoughts about seeing Cole convicted for her murder and she was thinking about coming forward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that would have ruined her, which is why you killed her.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: No, no, no. All I did was help Eva. I had nothing to do with her murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. James, when was the last time that you actually saw Eva?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: After we got back from the woods, we cleaned up her house and then I gave her a key to one of the company’s corporate apartments and I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Corporate apartment?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: She needed a place to stay until she could get out of the country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Robert James was nowhere near Westchester at the time of Cole’s death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That pretty much rules him out for both murders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It could also mean he was telling the truth that it was someone other than Eva that planned the setup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I think I know who that is. CSU checked on that corporate apartment. They found Eva’s fingerprints, but that’s not all they found.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: I’m just putting Cole’s affairs in order. I’m busy. Do you need something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Haskins, you should know what Cole Whitfield’s bloodwork came in showing high levels of sedatives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So high, in fact, he wouldn’t be able to hang himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we rechecked his phone records and noticed that you called his house on numerous occasions.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Of course I did. I’m general counsel for Cole’s company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but most of these phone calls came in after Cole was at work.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Eva consulted with me, as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s when you found out her marriage was falling apart. And about her prenup. So you whispered in her ear. Told her how she could punish Cole and make a little walking away money in the process.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Really? And why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we were surprised to learn that Cole’s first wife, Mallory, was a sorority sister of yours in college. And you were devastated by her death.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: We all were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you were the one who told friends that he got away with murder, so why, after all of these years, would you leave a top level law firm to join Cole’s company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s a theory. You took the job to insinuate yourself into Cole’s life. Searching for the right way, the right moment, to get revenge for Mallory. And you found it with Eva.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: That’s absurd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it? Eva called your cell phone from the corporate apartment landline after she was already supposedly dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eva got cold feet. She wanted to come forward but you couldn’t have that, not after all those years, after all that planning. So you decided that Eva’s fake murder would have to become a real one. And killing Cole was just a way of tying up loose ends.

utterance.speaker: AUBREY
utterance.content: Wow. That’s an exciting story, Mr. Castle. Maybe it will make a great book. But it doesn’t make for much of a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got a warrant. We found Eva’s blood and DNA in the trunk of your car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
